AI & EMERGING TECH.final_summary: A compilation of AI-related news for the week ending September 21, 2025, curated by ChatGPT, DeepSeek, Gemini, Grok, and W.H.L., covers developments in news, reality, artificial intelligence, cognition, and machine learning's future, culminating in a "Best of" list. Experts emphasize the importance of investing in good data and innovation to mitigate potential "disasters" as AI increasingly integrates into aging services, impacting back-office functions, staffing, and patient care. AWM&T Investment Management Team suggests patience and selectivity in Gen AI investments, noting Morgan Stanley's projection of a $1.5 trillion U.S. AI market by 2025 and the prediction of 1.5 million Gen AI jobs in the U.S. by the end of the next decade, contrasting with the U.K.'s stagnant Gen AI job growth. A new book, 'Artificial Intelligence: The Future of War' by Dr. Majid Rafizadeh, published by Oxford University Press and Simon & Schuster, explores AI's transformative potential to advance education, healthcare, and quality of life, while also addressing its capacity to intensify conflicts and raise ethical concerns as a weapon.

AI has already begun to make inroads in aging services in various applications — from the back office and staffing to resident and patient care. The artificial intelligence revolution isn’t on its way, and long-term care providers need to engage everyone around them to keep pace. all_summary.title: September 2025 Market Commentary
all_summary.summary: The AWM&T Investment Management Team shares its thoughts on Generative Artificial Intelligence (Gen AI) Two years ago, we shared our thoughts on Gen AI, its capabilities, potential economic impacts, and stock investment opportunities. We concluded that *P**atience is warranted as is being selective in investing, but if AI lives up to expectations and enthusiasm, it will generate tremendous value and wealth for companies and investors for years to come. In August, Morgan Stanley reported that the U.S. AI market is expected to reach $1.5 trillion by 2025. The U.K. is the only country in the world that has not seen a rise in the number of jobs created by Gen AI. Morgan Stanley predicts that by the end of the next decade, there will be 1.5 million Gen AI jobs in the United States.

all_summary.title: At Charlie Kirk memorial, Trump rallies MAGA against political ...
all_summary.summary: Artificial intelligence has become one of the most transformative and influential technologies of the modern era. It can serve humanity by advancing education, revolutionizing healthcare and improving quality of life across the globe. But it can also intensify conflicts, reshape military operations and raise serious ethical concerns when used as a weapon of war. The balance between these two realities will define how this technology shapes the future of our world, say the authors of the book. The book is published by Oxford University Press and is published in the U.S. by Simon & Schuster, a division of Penguin Random House. The author’s name is Dr. Majid Rafizadeh and the book is ‘Artificial Intelligence: The Future of War’.

WORLD.final_summary: As President Trump reduces U.S. funding to the United Nations, China, Russia, and Qatar are seeking to exert influence over the body's human rights and labor initiatives. Ambassadors from China and Cuba are advocating for restrictions on investigations into government-sanctioned abuses, including torture, war crimes, and the imprisonment of dissidents. BUSINESS.final_summary: Insignia Financial, one of Australia's largest wealth management companies and owner of MLC Australia, has selected Google Cloud to accelerate AI adoption and modernize its digital infrastructure. This move aims to enhance personalization, efficiency, and service delivery for its 1.5 million customers nationwide. The migration to Google Cloud is expected to significantly reduce complexity and manual effort in maintaining critical applications, strengthen cybersecurity and compliance, and drive tighter integration with its BigQuery data lake, supporting Insignia Financial's readiness for AI adoption at scale. The company anticipates a dramatic reduction in its on-premise footprint and associated costs, with minimal disruption to applications, while leveraging Google Cloud's AI capabilities across its offerings, including MLC superannuation member experience platforms.

all_summary.title: Insignia Financial selects Google Cloud to accelerate AI adoption ...
all_summary.summary: Insignia Financial selects Google Cloud to accelerate AI adoption and modernise digital infrastructure. The goal is to enhance personalization, efficiency, and service delivery for its 1.5 million customers nationwide. Insignia Financial is one of Australia's largest wealth management companies and owner of MLC Australia. Google Cloud is the new way to the cloud, providing AI capabilities across many of its offerings, including its MLC superannuation member experience platforms. The company expects the migration to significantly reduce complexity and manual effort associated with maintaining critical applications, while strengthening cybersecurity and compliance. Tighter integration with its BigQuery data lake is also expected to drive benefits, supporting Insignedia Financial's readiness for AI adoption at scale. The move will dramatically reduce our on-premise footprint and its associated costs, with minimal disruption to applications.

ENTERTAINMENT.final_summary: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle displayed a 'revamped' dynamic during their first public appearance since meeting with King Charles, while Prince Charles remains 'hesitant' about reconciliation with his son. Meanwhile, Prince William and Kate Middleton have revealed their future plans. In other news, Julianne Hough disclosed that she experienced 'the darkest time' of her life upon joining "Dancing With The Stars," and Angelina Jolie expressed her disillusionment with the United States, stating she doesn't 'recognize' the country amidst 'dark times'. In legal matters, Justin Baldoni has hired Diddy's lawyer in his legal battle with Blake Lively. Finally, Donald Trump surprised viewers on Fox News by revealing the amount of cash he carries on his person.
